content.description: Sit start at the arete with a pair of small edges. From there, pull up to the decent edges, traverse to your right using pinches and crimps. Once at the jugs, top it out.
content.location: This is on the east-face of the Taquero Vaquero Boulder.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the diagonal jug. From there, stand up to a left hand crimp, follow to a three-finger right hand edge (crux), then make a few moves up and left on the big fins, and top it out.
content.protection: A pad should to it, the landing is perfect.
content.location: It ascends the east face of Taquero Vaquero.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the horizontal rail. From there, make a big move to a sidepull (crux) on the large hueco, then continue to the shelf before the lip, make a big reach for the lip, and top it out.
content.protection: A pad should do it, the landing is very good.
content.location: It ascends the northeast overhang of Taquero Vaquero.

content.description: Sit start straddling the slightly overhung arete with thin, opposing left and right hand edges. From there, pull up (crux) to a left hand edge, follow suit with the right, then gain the patina edges at the false lip, work the feet up, and top it out.
content.protection: A pad should do it, the landing is fantastic.
content.location: This ascends the southeast arete of Taquero Vaquero.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on a horizontal edge. From there, move straight up the slight overhang on good edges to reach a solid topout.
content.protection: A pad will suffice, the landing doesn't get much better.
content.location: It ascends the center of Taquero Vaquero's east face.
